Article.Abstract: Optimum immunity against Mycobacterium tuberculosis requires both CD4(+) and CD8(+) T cells. In contrast with CD4(+) T cells, few antigens are known that elicit CD8(+) T cells during infection. CD8(+) T cells specific for culture filtrate protein-10 (CFP10) are found in purified protein derivative positive donors, suggesting that CFP10 primes CD8(+) T cells in vivo. Using T cells from M. tuberculosis-infected mice, we identified CFP10 epitopes recognized by CD8(+) T cells and CD4(+) T cells. CFP10-specific T cells were detected as early as week 3 after infection and at their peak accounted for up to 30% of CD8(+) T cells in the lung. IFNgamma-producing CD8(+) and CD4(+) T cells recognizing CFP10 epitopes were preferentially recruited to the lungs of M. tuberculosis-infected mice. In vivo cytolytic activity of CD8(+) T cells specific for CFP10 and TB10.3/10.4 proteins was detected in the spleen, pulmonary lymph nodes, and lungs of infected mice. The cytolytic activity persisted long term and could be detected 260 d after infection. This paper highlights the cytolytic function of antigen-specific CD8(+) T cells elicited by M. tuberculosis infection and demonstrates that large numbers of CFP10-specific cytolytic CD8(+) T cells are recruited to the lung after M. tuberculosis infection.
Article.ArticleTitle: Cytolytic CD8+ T cells recognizing CFP10 are recruited to the lung after Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection.
Article.Affiliations: Divsion of Rheumatology, Immunology, and Allergy, Brigham and Women's Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA 02115, USA.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Bacterial Proteins(immunology); CD4-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Female; Interferon-gamma(biosynthesis); Lung(immunology); Mice; Mice, Inbred Strains; Molecular Sequence Data; Tuberculosis(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar responses were shown with purified CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells in C3H/SnJ, BALB/c, and C57BL/6 mice. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar responses were shown with purified CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells in C3H/SnJ, BALB/c, and C57BL/6 mice. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Negative responses were shown with purified CD8+ T-cells in C3H/SnJ, BALB/c, and C57BL/6 mice. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A rapid increase in the frequency of CFP10-specific T cells occurred between 2 and 3 weeks after infection in the lung and spleen. The number of CFP10-specific CD4+ and CD8+ T cells steadily increased in the spleen and reached a peak between weeks 4 and 5. A less significant response was seen in the pulmonary lymph nodes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Negative responses were shown with purified CD8+ T-cells in C3H/SnJ, BALB/c, and C57BL/6 mice. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar responses were shown with purified CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells in C3H/SnJ, BALB/c, and C57BL/6 mice. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope was deduced based on the common residues of three reactive overlapping peptides. CD8+ T cells recognized the epitope (VESTAGSL) presented by B10.BR splenocytes (KkDkLk) and B10.A (KkDdLd) splenocytes, indicating that H-2Kk is the restricting element. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: No response was seen in BALB/c mice. A high frequency of H-2Kk tetramer-positive CD8+T cells was detected in the lungs of Mycobacterium tuberculosis–infected C3H mice, but not in B10.BR mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A rapid increase in the frequency of CFP10-specific T cells occurred between 2 and 3 weeks after infection in the lung and spleen. The number of CFP10-specific CD4+ and CD8+ T cells steadily increased in the spleen and reached a peak between weeks 4 and 5. A less significant response was seen in the pulmonary lymph nodes.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The purified T cells were stimulated with synthetic peptides and irradiated naive splenocytes as APCs for 48 hours in vitro.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: This epitope was deduced based on the common residues of three reactive overlapping peptides. Negative responses were shown with purified CD4+ T-cells. CD8+ T cells recognized the epitope (VESTAGSL) presented by B10.BR splenocytes (KkDkLk) and B10.A (KkDdLd) splenocytes, indicating that H-2Kk is the restrictingelement. Recombinant IL-2 and IL-15 were added to the assay medium at 100 U/ml and 20 ng/ml, respectively, to promote CD8+ T cell growth.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An in vivo cytotoxicity assay was performed using peptide-pulsed target splenocytes from naïve C3H mice which were injected into infected mice. Similar responses were seen in pulmonary lymph node and spleen, although responses were highest in the lungs.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice were immunized once via the aerosal route.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Infected BALB/c mice did not recognize the epitope, while they did recognize an H-2Kd-restricted Mycobacterium tuberculosis epitope (GYAGTLQSL).
